text: Óscar Bonfiglio Martínez (October 5, 1905 – November 4, 1987) was a Mexican football goalkeeper, and Olympian, who played for the Mexico national team in the 1930 World Cup. ==Career== Bonfiglio was the first goalkeeper beaten in World Cup history, with a goal by France forward Lucien Laurent. In two matches he conceded 10 goals: the most in the tournament. At the time, he played for the club Marte FC. Bonfiglio suffered an injury and retired from playing at age 28. Bonfiglio played for Mexico at the 1928 Amsterdam Summer Olympics. ==Personal== Bonfiglio is the father of actor Oscar Morelli. Bonfiglio is credited to be the founder of Mexican football team Irapuato FC back in 1948 ==References== * A.Gowarzewski : "FUJI Football Encyclopedia.
